title: AMD Next-Gen GPU Technology Breakthrough
subtitle: Project Amethyst: AMD & Sony Partnership for Future Graphics

presenters.name: Jack Huynh
presenters.title: Senior VP & GM of Computing and Graphics, AMD

three_core_technologies.name: 1. Radiance Cores
three_core_technologies.description: New dedicated hardware block specifically for ray traversal - the most computationally expensive part of ray tracing pipeline
benefits: Frees up CPU for geometry & simulation
Significant speed boost from hardware traversal logic
Over 2x RT throughput per compute unit vs RDNA 3
three_core_technologies.impact: AMD catching up to NVIDIA in ray tracing performance
three_core_technologies.technical_note: Takes full control of ray traversal independently from shader cores

three_core_technologies.name: 2. Neural Arrays
three_core_technologies.description: Infinity Fabric-like interconnect connecting every compute unit together, allowing direct communication without using cache
benefits: Connects entirety of compute units together
Allows CUs to talk to each other directly
Processes large chunks of screen in one go
Whole new level of ML performance
three_core_technologies.technical_note: Not just AI portions - connects entire compute unit architecture

three_core_technologies.name: 3. Universal Compression
three_core_technologies.description: Evaluates and compresses ALL available data within GPU to dramatically reduce memory bandwidth usage
benefits: Compresses all GPU data types (not just textures)
Only essential bytes sent to memory
three_core_technologies.technical_note: Goes far beyond current Delta Color Compression used by AMD/Sony/NVIDIA
three_core_technologies.comparison: Current: Only textures & render targets | New: ALL GPU data types

context_and_significance.future_gen: RDNA 5 / UDNA - where these technologies will debut
context_and_significance.competitive_position: Could help AMD leapfrog NVIDIA in all areas

improvements: Up to 40% higher performance per compute unit
Up to 8x INT8 AI performance vs RDNA 3

timeline.future_deployment: RDNA 5 / UDNA for PS6 & future GPUs

key_quotes.speaker: Jack Huynh
key_quotes.quote: Current GPU memory bandwidth limitations hinder the seamless adoption of next-gen rendering techniques

key_quotes.speaker: Mark Cerny
key_quotes.quote: There's a significant speed boost that comes from putting the traversal logic in hardware

key_quotes.speaker: Jack Huynh
key_quotes.quote: Universal Compression delivers new levels of performance with greater efficiency
